result.execSummary:
The defendant Allan J. Schubert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>2500-10,000g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)4.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Resisting/Failing to Stop, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for early discharge if complies with all conditions of probation and upon Agent's application.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full.  Taken out of cash bond posted.
Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Credit for 6 days, if probation is revoked.

timeConds.notes:
Stayed for up to 60 days or date set by Huber Law Officer.  Report today to establish start date.

***Amended 7/24/19 to grant a furlough from 10:00 am 7/24/19 and to report back by 4:00 pm on 7/24/19.
